page.title: 03FARM WORK IN 1985
page.content: Farm labourers work very hard and for long hours without earning very much money. Many live in houses which belong to the farm so they cannot change jobs or homes very easily. Farm workers have to be able to handle complicated machinery such as sprayers for fertilisers and weed killers as well as the huge combine harvesters. Last year a new vegetable planter was introduced. This has cups like ice-cream cornets which go round in a clockwise direction. As a cup passes him, the man handling the machine puts in a young plant, which is then placed firmly in the ground. There are four sets of cups to each machine which is pulled by a tractor. Potato and sugar beet harvesting is also highly mechanised. A scoop lifts the vegetables, tops them and loads them onto conveyor belts for sorting.
